intro: Tetrapterys guilleminiana f. oblonga, commonly known as the oblong leaf guilleminia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pale yellow to white in color. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along riverbanks.
